channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NJ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NJ

item.title: Report X-2024050335
item.description:
Report X-2024050335

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-10T15:12:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-06
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During the day sort, the package arrived at the hazmat cage in a bag with suspicions of internal leakage. Upon inspection, suspicion was confirmed by a semi sealed lid on the drum containing paint. Lid attachments weren't fully tighten on to the drum causing a slight escape area. Paint spilled and soiled drum, drying up all around the lid opening. Most of leakage was contained by a plastic bag that drum was placed in to be shipped out, slight paint did escape and soiled the inner & outer packaging box. Drum was placed into a salvage drum to await disposition from PGH.

item.title: Report X-2024050323
item.description:
Report X-2024050323

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-10T15:12:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-05
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: DURING THE OVERNIGHT SORT THE PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO THE HAZMAT CAGE SHOWING OBVIOUS SIGNS OF INTERNAL LEKAGE. UPON INSPECTION ONE OF TWO BOTTLE OF ZEP CONCENTRATED INDUSTRIAL PURPLE DEGREASER WAS FOUND TO BE SLIGHTLY LEAKING FROM A LOOSE CAP. THE CAP WAS TIGHTEN AND THE CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A LINED SALVAGE DRUM TO BE RETURN TO SHIPPER UNLESS OTHERWISE.

  • Description: Package arrived at hazmat cage during sunrise sort. Inspection showed package was wet with internal leakage, torn, and 1 of 4 items with a loose cap. damage most likely caused from being placed on wrong conveyor belt. Remaining contents will be returned to shipper in a salvage drum, unless otherwise stated.

item.title: Report X-2024050293
item.description:
Report X-2024050293

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-10T15:12:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-03
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: IT APPEARS THE SHIPMENT WAS REMOVED FROM THE SYSTEM FLOW, DUE TO THE EXTERNAL CARTON BEING TORN AND WET DURING THE DAY SORT. UPON INSPECTION OF INNER CONTENTS DURING THE TWILIGHT SHIFT 4X1GALLON (PLASTIC BOTTLES) QUALITY CHEMICAL DENATURED ALCOHOL (ETHANOL) CAP ALL 4 BOTTLES WERE TURNED DOWN AND CAUSED LEAKAGING ALLOWING 20% SPILLAGE. WHICH ALSO CAUSED DAMAGE TO THE OUTER PACKAGING AS WELL. FACILITY PROCEDURES FOR DAMAGED HAZARDOUS MATERIAL FOLLOWED, CONTENTS CONTAINED AND AWAITING DISPOSITION.

item.title: Report I-2024050018
item.description:
Report I-2024050018

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-07
  • City: Newark
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Approximately 4 hours into the flight, Mr. Vitale, sitting on 22F, approached FA with his laptop and brought concern about it being extremally hot FA stated there was no smoke, flames or sparks coming from the laptop The device was placed in the TCB, which was stored in AFT Lavatory AFT Iavatory was blocked and monitored every 30 minutes Upon arrival TCB was handed to CSR Customer Information: Name: Piero Vitalle Address: 7901 Hispanola Ave Apt 805 North Bay Village FL 33141 Phone: 786-942-8949 Email: Piarevitale@gmail.com

item.description:
Report X-2024050134

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-06T15:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-01
  • City: west deptford
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: shipment taken out of system flow due to package leaking package found n trailer #807854 already damaged leaking upon inspection of contents 1x50lbs plastic pail of Calcuim hypochlorite the 50lbs plastic pail was cracked broken and leaking allowing 5lbs of the chemical powder to release no slotted partition bags or absorbent was found facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed contents contained and awaiting dispoistion

item.title: Report X-2024050114
item.description:
Report X-2024050114

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-06T15:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-30
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During the day sort, the package arrived at the hazmat cage busted open and with visible wet conditions. Upon inspection only 2 of the 4 bottles were found inside the package. 2 Bottles of Part B are currently missing. Most likely both bottles of part B completely leaked out causing soiling of the outer packaging resulting the box to rip and tear apart and bottles getting lost in the unloading phase movements. Remaining 2 Part A bottles are undamaged. Bottles were placed into a salvage drum to await disposition from PGH.

item.title: Report X-2024050125
item.description:
Report X-2024050125

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-06T15:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-30
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During the sunrise sort, the package arrived at the hazmat cage. Upon inspection, the outer packaging was found with a hole due to fiberboard box getting wet with the solution. 3 of 4 plastic bottles were found with a loose cap causing slight leakage of about 1 tablespoon/teaspoon on all 3 bottles. Bottles were closed all the way and placed into a salvage drum to await disposition from PGH. Package failure was mainly due to the loose caps causing the alka-brite plus condenser coil cleaner to leak during the loading phase.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Maybe proper handling of Hazmat package will prevent damages in the future. Even stronger fiberboard boxes and inner padding will be of better protection of hazmat contents. Seals on caps can also be useful in preventing leakage and damages

item.title: Report X-2024050141
item.description:
Report X-2024050141

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-06T15:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-20
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package arrived at hazmat during sunrise sort in a plastic bin. Inspection showed package to be wet, torn open, and 1 of 4 items had a loose cap. Damage most likely caused from being dropped or mishandled during unloading process. Remaining contents will be returned to shipper in a salvage drum, unless otherwise stated.
